subject: Admin API policy enforcement contingent on is_admin_project

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

We have some documentation around our policy file. Could you update it to document this new rule, Adam?

Further, could you comment here with a good way to test that this does what it promises?

Patch Set 1:

adding to Ian's comments:

because of the impact of changes to policy files, which are operator customizable and potentially managed by configuration management systems, we should have a release note[1] for added specifically for this item.  The release note only needs 'upgrade' and 'fixes' section entries.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/usage.html#creating-new-release-notes

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

with context_is_admin unchanged, I think we'll need changes in places like https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/48ee8ef4793ed40397613193f09872f474c11abe/glance/api/authorization.py#L26 to properly restrict cross-project access to admins with is_admin_project:True.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Shouldn't we deprecate https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/48ee8ef4793ed40397613193f09872f474c11abe/glance/api/middleware/context.py#L48 also?
This property must be managed by keystone or policies only IMO. So glance must get rid of this property.

Patch Set 2:

So yeah, we could get rid of it in another patch and concentrate on admin_api policies only(as referenced in the bug). 
If we change default policy file I think we need to change default rules also: 
https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/48ee8ef4793ed40397613193f09872f474c11abe/glance/api/policy.py#L33
Unfortunately, glance does not have policy defaults in conf like nova=(.
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3:

Added reno and fixed DEFAULT RULE.  Need to address [0] still.  Removal of config will be done via patch [1].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/48ee8ef4793ed40397613193f09872f474c11abe/glance/api/authorization.py#L26
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/465679/

Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

you forgot to check the project here: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/v2/images.py#L219
Sorry,i am bit out of context, iiuc admin is only a user from admin project. so why you did not update is_admin isn middlewares: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/middleware/context.py#L196
so after that you don't need to update glance code because you changed the definition of admin itself. it won't be backward compatible but it is not compatible in current implementation.

Abandoned

Abandoning in favor of Session scope.
